description.narrative: By the end of 2020, government at central level and at decentralized level in targeted regions have the capacity to do an evidence- based planning, coordination, monitoring and evaluation of C4D interventions to promote a minimum of 12 essential family practices (EFP).

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2020, government at central level and at decentralized level in targeted regions have the capacity to do an evidence- based planning, coordination, monitoring and evaluation of C4D interventions to promote a minimum of 12 essential family practices (EFP).

description.narrative: In 2019, UNICEF helped develop and implement sectoral communication strategies and plans at the central and regional levels. The efforts of the C4D section facilitated the establishment of a pool of trainers at central and regional level with C4D focal points from key technical ministries (Health, Communication, Decentralization) with capacities strengthened in strategic planning and participatory communication. Partners implemented and coordinated the promotion of six essential family practices (exclusive breastfeeding, combating child marriage, food diversification, schooling, handwashing, immunization), the polio campaign, and the participation and commitment of adolescents and young people as agents of change. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Cumulative number and % of key officials in the ministries having increased capacity on the C4D strategies for the promotion of EFP
Cumulative number and % of key officials in the target regional directions and districts having increased capacity on the C4D strategies for the promotion of EFP

Quality and extent of data available on EFP: Minimal : not sufficient to drive C4D programme or to judge performance, Moderate : sufficient to plan actions and to monitor short-term results, Optimal : sufficient to enable long-term planning and the evaluation of impact
